tests.explanation: The test case consists of dates of January 1 and February 1 of the year 2000. In the original program code, the numDays variable should be calculated as day2+(daysIn[month1]-day1) + daysIn[2], because it is a leap year. The mutant code changes the condition to determine if it is a leap year by replacing m4 != 0 to m4 != 2. The calculation of numDays becomes day2+(daysIn[month1]-day1), because the original code in the else statement later would not make any change in the daysIn array due to the condition being false for mutation. Therefore, the mutant code results in a different output from the original code, where 31-30=1.
The test case consists of dates between November 20 and December 15 of the year 2020. Because this year is not a leap year, the output of the mutant code is the same as the original code, 25.
The test case consists of dates between February 1 and February 28 of the year 2001. Because this year is not a leap year, the output of both the original and the mutant code is 27.

The mutant code changes the condition on line 16 to check whether m4 is not equal to 28, this will always be true as m4 can only have values from 0 to 3. Therefore, the daysIn array will always be set to 28 which is incorrect for a leap year resulting in incorrect output.
This test case is not affected by the mutant code as it does not involve a leap year.
This test case is not affected by the mutant code as it involves a leap year and the mutant program also correctly handles leap years.
